conversations.content: The Chief Researcher's Notes: Part One
These are the notes of a researcher who came to our world from another.
(Day 3) I faced many surprises since arriving in this world, but now that things have begun to settle down, I can finally begin my fieldwork.
To that end, I intend to record my notes on recent developments and future tasks to be accomplished.
The Soaratorium crashed here after being drawn through a tear between worlds. I realize how ludicrous this sounds, yet I cannot deny the truth I see with my own eyes.
This world is significantly different from our own, filled with never- before-seen cultures and creatures.
Tomorrow, I intend to travel about and learn more of such things from the residents of this world.
(Day 10) I have heard many fascinating stories from the people of the Halidom and nearby villages, but none intrigued me more than the tales of ＂dragons.＂
These dragons govern both nature and mana, and live side-by-side with humans. (Apparently they were fierce enemies until 1,000 years ago, but that tale can wait for another time.)
What fascinates me most of all is the power of ＂shapeshifting＂ that is possessed by the good prince Euden, as well as some of his friends.
They have the ability to wield power by assuming the form of a pactbound dragon—something that does not exist in our world. Oh, but there is so much to learn!
(Day 12) It seems we of the Soaratorium were not the only ones who crossed into this world—a Rathalos has also made the journey!
There isn't a hunter in our world who doesn't tremble at the very mention of the King of the Skies, and now it has followed us here.
Since coming to this world, it's begun to adapt to its new environment, even going so far as to build a nest.
Such changes are inevitable, I suppose, but it makes them no less fascinating—and there are doubtless plenty yet in store.
(Day 13) It's possible this world has changed the Rathalos's characteristics in some way. As a Wycademy researcher, I must investigate!
I won't let my thoughts be colored by second-hand evidence. I must see the truth with my own eyes—which means I must approach the Rathalos.
Unfortunately, I don't have enough knowledge of this world to do so. Ordinarily, I'd enlist the help of a willing hunter, but this time I must take a different approach.
For while this world may lack a Hunter's Guild, I still have some fine allies. I shall draft a request at once and ask for their aid in this matter.
The Chief Researcher's Notes: Part Two
These notes were left behind by a researcher from another world who sought to study a Rathalos that crossed over with him.
(Day 15) This world lacks the Hunter's Guild I am familiar with, but I have found myself blessed with allies who are equally dependable.
So when I asked for companions to accompany me on a trip to investigate the Rathalos, help was given by the prince and his folk.
We made a number of fascinating discoveries during our pursuit.
First, there seems to have been little fundamental change in the Rathalos. However, I did notice a slight, but peculiar, change in the evidence it leaves behind.
Changes include wyvern tears mixed with mana, increased fluid temps, and scales with greater fire resistance.
None of these changes are major, yet I feel certain they warrant continued investigation. As such, I must inform my new escorts of my desire to continue my research.
(Day 17) Our investigation eventually led us to a deserted wasteland.
The Rathalos we have been pursuing seems to have made its home here. My friends informed me that the area became desolate after the dragon governing its mana disappeared.
As they said, it was completely devoid of life—although should another dragon choose to bind with it, it would be blessed with life once more.
But then why did Rathalos choose this of all places to make its nest?
Together, we were able to discover a clue that may answer that question: small, new leaves peeking out from beneath the parched earth.
But that prompted the prince to ask a new question—how was that possible when the area had no dragon to govern its mana?
